newsitem.title: RUSSIA: MGTS plans $150 mln Eurobond in July or September.
newsitem.headline: MGTS plans $150 mln Eurobond in July or September.

text.p: Russian regional telecommunications company MGTS plans to issue a $150 million Eurobond at the end of July or in mid-September, commercial director Semyon Rabovsky said on Friday.
"We expect to issue a Eurobond at the end of July or maybe mid-September -- August is just not a good time. It will be about a $150 million," he told Reuters.
The bond is to be lead-managed by U.S. investment banks Salomon Bros and CS First Boston.

A chart distributed by OAO Moskovskaya Gorodskaya Telefonnaya Set (MGTS) at a CS First Boston investment conference on Friday showed the company, which provides local telecoms services in the Moscow area, planned a maturity of three to five years, with a coupon of 9.5 percent.
Rabovsky said he did not expect the Eurobond to be marketed in the U.S. because of difficulties in conforming with U.S. securities legislation.
